item.description:
Hi Everyone,

i AM JUST GOING TO ASSUME SUNDAY IS THE BETTER DAY OF THE WEEKEND ? --

RSVP IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN PADDLING THIS UNIQUE LOCATION.

PLEASE INDICATE IF you will be attending the social AFTER-PARTY AND BARBIE-Q. 


WEATHER: Warm Enough but Cloudy, Low chance of rain, Low wind... I am going, Join me if you want.

 

For the latest update on weather: http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KIJD&state=CT

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

First off,  after we are ready to paddle--- we TAKE a RIGHT and will go upstream for a bit of exploring and see how the river is flowing,  after THAT its go down through the marshes bearing right and to the lake area to see the Damm.

On the return bear right to explore the other marsh area untill we meetup with the original river.

We end up at the same put in.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bring some POT LUCK food..and your favourite beverages for the group Barbie-q after. Bring what you really like and some more. We might like it and will eat it even if its a doubble with someone else. The Group Pot Luck barbie-q is the second half to a PERFECT outing also right by the river after the paddle...(if you didnt get a chance to paddle with us this is also open to people interested in meeting us ...Bring chairs..and whatever else you like to sit around on. The grill (canopy..etc) is loaded and ready only if enough of you indicate you will attend.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Getting there:

FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS..because there are 2 Plains roads in the area.

From Hartford: take I 84 east to exit 59 onto I - 384 EAST....

When I - 384 ends at rte 6 and 44 split ..take the left split = rte 44 EAST....

go for 7.8 miles (just past Mansfield Depot) and turn right (South) onto rte 32 (Stafford Rd)

go apx 0.36 miles then take a right on to PLAINS RD.

Go about 0.25 miles just past the RR tracks and take a right into the parking area just before the River Bridge.

GPS, to get close enough: use 1210 Stafford Road, Storrs - Mansfield , CT

This will get you near the "PLAINS RD" we will be on (there are 2 in the town and GPS's may mixem up) follow the directions above and compare to your specific directions.

 

 

###  Some Kayaks are available if you want to use one of mine:

ANY of MY KAYAKS need to be reserved prior to me leaving for the PADDLE SITE preferably by the night prior to or the event: (i may not get a chance to check the site in the morning of the event).

Yes its a STRAPPING & WAPPING $20.00 PER FULL DAY for kayak types and brands you simply can not get from any other source.

(This is really a donation i do need to maintain, repair, and add new equipment over time. it also covers the costs of the Decent Quality boats with all the Special accessories and the transportation to and from the site.)


I have some cheap life jackets and some GOOD ones, (Remember a decent life jacket should be a top quality one, its cheap life insurance).
One is a Medium Kokatat* Ladies MsFit Tour: (this is also purchased by guys since it has a great fit and versatility) Its really too small for me, but i like the way it works.http://www.rei.com/product/751058

&  one is :   http://www.watersports.co/womens-kayak-life-vests/c1000001793/stohlquist-towmotion-womens-kayak-life-jacket-2010-p219446.html

If using my boats you have to wear the life jacket, i can't be responsible for your stupidity if you don't since its common knowledge to practice safety in this and all other paddling groups.


#### 
All my yaks come with the TOP RATED Werner Carbon Kalliste Paddles because they are Hollow and light (my recommended brand and type). Different lengths (220-230) and types (strait, or ergonomic bent, small and normal shaft dia's.)
You choose your preference.http://www.wernerpaddles.com/paddles/touring/performance_core/kalliste/
####

Also for comfort is my favourite "Yak Pad's" optional accessory to all yaks on trips that we are actually going somewhere. http://www.yakpads.com/11-paddle-saddle-with-high-backrest.html 
####

BOW DECK BAGS are now placed on kayaks to hold water , accessories and other items needed for quick and easy access:http://www.kayakproshop.com/SL_deckbag.html

####

PLEASE INDICATE WHICH KAYAK YOU FIT IN AND OR CAN HANDLE in your RSVP if you need one of the following Yaks:

(I CAN SUGGEST WHICH ONE IF NEEDED based on your physical size and skills if you are not sure).

####

NEW TO THE FLEET--->KAYAK A:       Home Depot Cull Wood & Luan Plywood Panel Special 15'  (Don't laugh , this boat is acceptable and actually will get finished over the summer or it will be used for a end of the season campfire).

This Kayak was built using scrap wood of all sorts and is now part of the fleet.

It is moderately stable and moves along quite well, (I have not checked its cruising speed or top speed yet). Im sure i will see someone paddling it to shore pretty fast though.

It has a removable Johnson* toilet seat and a YakPadz seat back pad available but i have no foot pegs installed yet. Bailing Sponge is included.

---AVAILABLE---      --- ---


####

KAYAK 1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide. 

Highly stable (initial & secondary) comfortable expedition Sea kayak moderate weight (52 LB).
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills. 
http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer 
---RESERVED---      ---CHERI'S GUEST ---

 

####

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.  http://www.neckykayaks.com/kayaks/touring/eliza_polymer.shtml 

---AVAILABLE---         --- ---


####

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series. http://www.belhavencanoe.com/Necky/Eliza%20Comp/Elizacomp.htm

---AVAILABLE ---        --- ---


####

KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version (Very Thin Fiberglass and now with reinforced floor), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide. 

Stable and predictable Transitional type Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills. 
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit. http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

---AVAILABLE---         --- ---

  

####

KAYAK #5:        Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, fixed skeg 18' @ 19.6" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea kayak with Greenland style hull (50 lbs). Greenland Paddle available also if desired. Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills. http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

---AVAILABLE---           --- ---

 

####

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style fast kayak. 18' @ 21" wide

Low initial but high secondary stability when on full edge. Medium sized paddler (150-200 lbs) with Intermediate to Advanced paddling skills. 
http://www.atlantickayaktours.com/pages/retail/boats/ndk/Greenlander-Pro.shtml

---AVAILABLE---             --- ---
item.how_to_find_us: Look for ME WEARING THE ORANGE HUNTING HAT at the unloading area.
item.why: You will be like Pop Eye. Kyaaaaaaaak,yak, yak yak,,

item.name: SUNDAY--WILLIE RVR- Plains Rd, (Eagleville Dam + Upstrm) & PotLuck Barbie-Q@site
